conclusion: Determine if motion direction from 2 to 3 seconds is same or opposite to positive direction.
Positive direction is defined by positive values on the vertical axis.
Velocity is constant and positive from t=0 to t=1; at t=1, velocity is 2 m/s.
Velocity decreases linearly to zero from t=1 to t=2; at t=2, velocity is 0 m/s.
Velocity becomes negative from t=2 to t=3.
Before t=2, velocity is positive, indicating motion in positive direction.
After t=2, velocity is negative, indicating motion in opposite direction.
Motion direction from t=2 to t=3 is opposite to the defined positive direction.
